reviews.text: there are two motel 6s in ogden. i stayed at the one on washington street. the room was large and it looked like all other motel 6 rooms. the only negative thing about this motel was that the walls are thinner than other motel 6s, you can hear the tv in the next room. and the inner hallway can be noisy. otherwise it was an ok place tom stay and probably better than other cheap motels in ogden. ask for a room in the back away from street noise (the non-smoking rooms) and ask for a room with a mountain view.
reviews.title: good deal for the price

reviews.text: I'd seen mixed reviews about this location, but more positive than negative and decided to try it.
reviews.title: Pleasant, corfortable stay

reviews.text: Had made reservations early in an attempt to get a downstairs single with frig and microwave. On arrival, the premises were attractive, the check-in was flawless and pleasant, and they had the exact room requested (in a slightly inconvenient location). The room itself was a very pleasant surprise: huge, totally clean and attractive, with a small refrigerator (no freezer compartment) and microwave, and still better, a really comfortable king-size bed. ( Should mention that Motel 6s back in the 60s-90's, when I did most of my traveling for business before retirement, seldom had good beds - for me, anyway - but this was a definite departure from that).
reviews.title: Good price good stay

reviews.text: Looked to me as if the motel (certainly my room, at least) had been totally redone within the last year or two. This room even had an individual thru-the-outside-wall combo heating-cooling unit that's so convenient. And almost best of all, not the messy old-style shower head they've been using for 30-40 years now. This one gave a neat and controlled spray.
reviews.title: Worst hotel ever!

reviews.text: Because it's so good for the cost I think it truly deserves a full 5.
reviews.title: Comfortable and convenient
Red Roof was great!
reviews.text: The Red Roof Inn, in Ogden, was excellent. The room was large, clean and quiet. I would definitely stay there again. The front desk girl was super nice. No complaints.

reviews.title: No problems here
reviews.text: This is a nice, basic hotel. Our room was huge, it was quiet, and clean. Price was fabulous... No troubles.

reviews.title: Good for one night stopover, airport noise was a problem
reviews.text: Rooms are modern and somewhat comfortable.
I do not understand those harking on excitedly about fantastic value. It's a $50 motel and you should expect to get what you pay for.
reviews.title: So, so. What you'd expect for $55

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Room itself was pretty clean and the beds were fine. Staff good.
reviews.title: Wonderful Customer Service!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Unfortunately, the security of the place looks a little bleak with dubious people hanging around who do not appear to be staying.
reviews.title: Nice motel!

reviews.text: Walls are paper thin. The lovely people above could be heard stomping around sending the noise echoing around the our room below. I'm used to this from most hotels, but this was LOUD! Could even hear them talking.
reviews.title: Great Value

reviews.text: Advice. Park as close to the reception as possible and take a second floor room.
reviews.title: So Good, can it be a Motel 6 !
